poem:
**The Takeover**

Hargreaves shuns the open market's sigh,
Billionaire roots soak greed's supply.
A whisper in the financial night,
£11.40 shares ignite.

City columns crumble, beams lost,
Equity, the private cost.
Hundreds of millions—cash in flight,
Common folk fade from the skyline's light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Investment platform Hargreaves Lansdown agrees £5.4bn takeover Hargreaves Lansdown has agreed a £5.4bn takeover by private equity suitors that will give hundreds of millions of pounds to its billionaire founders and result in the investment supermarket becoming the latest company to leave the London stock market. Board members of the FTSE 100 company recommended the £11.40-a-share offer, which requires shareholder approval. The announcement comes almost four months after Hargreaves was first approached with a £9.85-a-share". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
